metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3248 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Untrusted search path vulnerability in Puppet Enterprise 2.8 before 2.8.7, Puppet before 2.7.26 and 3.x before 3.6.2, Facter 1.6.x and 2.x before 2.0.2, Hiera before 1.3.4, and Mcollective before 2.5.2, when running with Ruby 1.9.1 or earlier, allows local users to gain privileges via a Trojan horse file in the current working directory, as demonstrated using (1) rubygems/defaults/operating_system.rb, (2) Win32API.rb, (3) Win32API.so, (4) safe_yaml.rb, (5) safe_yaml/deep.rb, or (6) safe_yaml/deep.so; or (7) operatingsystem.rb, (8) operatingsystem.so, (9) osfamily.rb, or (10) osfamily.so in puppet/confine.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3248` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

puppet - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1.2
puppet-common - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1.2
puppet-el - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1.2
puppet-testsuite - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1.2
puppetmaster - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1.2
puppetmaster-common - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1.2
puppetmaster-passenger - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1.2
vim-puppet - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: facter package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
mcollective: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
puppet package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.3-1ubuntu1.2').
ruby-hiera: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
